intro: Carex tapintzensis, commonly known as the Tapintzen sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. This plant typically grows in moist, rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are grass-like, with a dense, cylindrical inflorescence that bears small, spike-like flowers. Carex tapintzensis plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation to high-altitude conditions.
